events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle on the highway. Initial details about the accident and damage to the car were provided.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident after confirming the keywords matched vehicle collision and accident.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the investigation and support customer communications.
Customer received official acknowledgment of the claim acceptance by the insurer and was informed about the next steps in the process.
Customer was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and proof of insurance coverage for further assessment.
All requested documents including accident photos and police report were submitted by the customer for claim processing.
The claim investigation officially started with the assigned agent reviewing the submitted evidence and contacting involved parties.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured vehicle had significant damages from the collision, requiring repairs.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the customer for review and approval.
Customer expressed dissatisfaction with the proposed settlement amount, stating it did not cover all repair expenses.
Due to customer feedback, the claim was escalated to the senior claims manager for reassessment of the settlement offer.
After review, an increased settlement amount was approved to better meet the customer’s repair cost requirements.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the customer’s bank account, covering the full repair cost as agreed.
The claim was officially closed following successful payment issuance and confirmation from the customer about vehicle repair completion.
